pr_title: EQL: Fix early trimming of in-flight data

timeline.message:
EQL: Fix early trimming of in-flight data

Rework trimToLast to take into account an ordinal for last trimming so
instead of keeping the last entry in a stage, it keeps the last entry
before the given ordinal.
This takes care of the case where a dense stage that requires several
passes does not discard valid data from a previous sparse stage that go
beyond the current stage point.

replies.bodyText: Will pick them up in a separate PR to avoid another build.
replies.author: costin

timeline.body: Wondering if `@Nullable` would be welcome here, as an indicator of `null` as a branching value?
timeline.bodyText: Wondering if @Nullable would be welcome here, as an indicator of null as a branching value?
timeline.bodyHTML: Wondering if @Nullable would be welcome here, as an indicator of null as a branching value?
timeline.author: bpintea

replies.bodyText: I'm not a fan of @Nullable since it doesn't enforce anything nor it is used consistently through-out the code.
replies.author: costin
